intro: Minuartia recurva subsp. asiatica, commonly known as the Asian rock-cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically forms dense mats on rocky or sandy soils, often in alpine or arctic environments. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are white or pale yellow. It is adapted to harsh climates and is often found in mountainous regions across eastern Asia.
